meanings.definition: The belief in or advocacy of a system of laws or rules as the basis of morality.
meanings.sent1: Her strong nomism guided her actions towards what she believed was right.
meanings.sent2: In their society, nomism played a crucial role in shaping people's behavior.
meanings.sent3: The nomism of always wearing matching socks led to some funny fashion choices.
meanings.sent4: His nomism of following traffic rules to the letter made him a safe driver.
meanings.sent5: The nomism of honesty was ingrained in her from a young age.

meanings.definition: The practice of adhering to a system of laws or rules as the basis of morality.
meanings.sent1: Their nomism involved daily meditation and reflection on their actions.
meanings.sent2: Nomism was evident in the way they conducted themselves in both personal and professional matters.
meanings.sent3: The nomism of always arriving early to meetings sometimes caused confusion.
meanings.sent4: Her nomism of kindness towards all living beings made her a beloved figure in the community.
meanings.sent5: The nomism of forgiveness was a central theme in their family's values.
